It's fun, and I tend to have for the most part less-toxic competitive games. However if you are either really bad, or it's your first game of the day, please, take my word, don't play comp. Besides getting yelled at for missing shots on my first game, I would say it's a fun satisfying shooter, minus the ranking system taking wayyy too long to rank up.

My personal favorite FPS game. Incredibly friendly toward new players yet gets more competitive as your rank and game knowledge increases. I personally love coming home after work on a Saturday night to see some of the boys in discord. The feeling of ranking up with your friends is great and this game gives you that reward that others don;t offer. Pros: Friendly, Smooth mechanics, unique, competitive/casual experiences. Cons: Potential cheaters if you don't option to play on a 3rd party service,  4v5 from teammates leaving, no sense as to when you are close to ranking up, games lasting 30 min+
